SEARCH
Package appDomain

Class Program

java.lang.Object
appDomain.Program
public class Program extends Object
The Program class is responsible for interpreting and validating the command-line arguments passed into the program. It acts as the configuration handler for the entire application, extracting: - The input file name containing shape data. - The comparison type (height, area, or volume). - The sorting algorithm to use (e.g., quick, merge, bubble). The class also ensures that all user-provided parameters are valid before the sorting operation begins. This prevents runtime errors caused by invalid or missing input.

  • Constructor Details

    • Program

      public Program(String[] args)
      Constructs a new Program instance and immediately processes the provided command-line arguments.

      This constructor delegates to the parseArgs(String[]) method, which extracts the input file name, comparison type, and sorting type from the given arguments. It also normalizes and sanitizes the input to handle variations in dashes, quotes, and case sensitivity.

      Parameters:
      args - the command-line arguments passed to the application. Expected format:
      • -f<filename> — specifies the input data file
      • -t<type> — comparison type (h = height, a = area, v = volume)
      • -s<sort> — sorting algorithm (b = bubble, i = insertion, s = selection, m = merge, q = quick, h = heap)

      If any argument is missing or malformed, defaults are applied: height comparison (h) and bubble sort (b).

  • Method Details

    • validateInput

      public boolean validateInput()
      Validates the parsed command-line inputs to ensure they are valid. Displays helpful error messages for invalid input.
      Returns:
      true if inputs are valid, false if any are invalid.
